titleStmt.title: A briefe declaration of the sacraments expressing the fyrst oryginall how they came vp, a[n]d were institute with the true and mooste syncere meaning and vnderstandyng of the same very necessarye for all men, that wyl not erre in the true vse and receauing therof. Compyled by the godly learned man Wyllyam Tyndall.
Fruitefull and godly treatise expressing the right institution and usage of the sacramentes
titleStmt.author: Tyndale, William, d. 1536.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A14135 of text S118858 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 24445). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 80 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 41 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1475-1640 ; 156:5)

titleStmt.title: A briefe declaration of the sacraments expressing the fyrst oryginall how they came vp, a[n]d were institute with the true and mooste syncere meaning and vnderstandyng of the same very necessarye for all men, that wyl not erre in the true vse and receauing therof. Compyled by the godly learned man Wyllyam Tyndall.
Fruitefull and godly treatise expressing the right institution and usage of the sacramentes

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Stoughton. Dwellynge within Ludgate, at the sygne of the Bisshoppes Miter,

notesStmt.note: Originally published as "A friutefull and godly treatise expressing the right institution and usage of the sacramentes". No copy of this original edition survives.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
